abstract.p: Embraer, Brazilian jet maker, plans to raise $307.5 million in public offering of up to 52.8 million new nonvoting preferred shares in Brazil and on New York Stock Exchange; three shareholders will sell added 31.2 million preferred shares (S)

block.p: Embraer of Brazil, a leading maker of regional jets, intends to raise $307.5 million in a public share offering in Brazil and on the New York Stock Exchange. The company will sell up to 52.8 million new nonvoting preferred shares to finance a new factory and research complex in Sao Paulo. Three Embraer shareholders -- Simonsen Financial Holdings Ltd., the Bank of Brazil's pension fund, Previ, and the Brazilian National Development Bank -- will sell an additional 31.2 million preferred shares. Embraer is one of Brazil's most successful companies and demand for its regional jets has been growing in recent years.
